creditline: Gift of the Robert Rauschenberg Foundation and the P.D. McMillan Memorial Fund
description: white ground; vertical format; 11 orange and red doilies in ULQ with smudged pencil lines; bottom 1/3 of image is reproduction of photograph of curtain with Donald Duck motif, with child's feet and legs in LLC; reproduction of photograph of old camera with framed snapshots of people in a park; black and white photo reproductions with some orange areas at bottom of image
image_copyright: © 2013 Estate of Robert Rauschenberg %2F Robert Rauschenberg Foundation
marks: Signature and Date at bottom edge, in silver: [RAUSCHENBERG 85]
medium: Acrylic, pencil, and crocheted doilies on canvas
text: An arrangement of crimson poinsettias resembles a “Calaveras” (or sugar skull), suggesting the vibrant colors and rich religious traditions of Mexican culture. Below, a black-and-white screenprint of photographs taken by the artist is collaged with other pictures that he found in Mexico City during his global art tour known as ROCI (Rauschenberg Overseas Cultural Interchange). Made with local craftsmen and materials, the piece explores Mexican visual culture and implies that local artistic communities and traditions offer dialogues that can transcend cultural differences.
title: Park/ROCI Mexico
